title: 114_hr2930
content: The Act is titled the "Long Island Sound Restoration and Stewardship Act" and includes amendments. The Long Island Sound Restoration Program under the Federal Water Pollution Control Act is amended to establish an office near Long Island Sound for administration and staffing purposes. The Long Island Sound Restoration Program is amended to include environmental impacts on the Long Island Sound watershed, focusing on identifying vulnerabilities and implementing adaptation strategies. The Long Island Sound Restoration Program is amended to include strategies for reducing vulnerabilities to sea level rise, assessing impacts on water quality, habitat, and infrastructure, and planning initiatives to identify suitable areas for various activities to reduce conflicts and preserve ecosystem services. The Long Island Sound Restoration Program is amended to develop strategies for increasing public awareness, monitoring progress towards goals, and implementing a monitoring system for the Comprehensive Conservation and Management Plan. The Long Island Sound Restoration Program is amended to include the implementation and support of a monitoring system for ecological health and water quality conditions. This includes reporting progress biennially to Congress. The Long Island Sound Restoration Program includes assessing progress towards goals, evaluating ecosystem health, describing modifications to the plan, and providing recommendations for improvement. The Long Island Sound Restoration Program includes assessing progress, evaluating ecosystem health, and recommending modifications to the conservation plan for the next 2 years. The report will be made public, including online, and the President must include information on funding coordination in the annual budget plan. Section 1105(a) of title 31, United States Code requires information on each Federal department and agency involved in protecting and restoring the Long Island Sound watershed. This includes an interagency budget display for projects and studies, along with proposed budgets for future years. The Administrator coordinates Federal actions to improve water quality in the Long Island Sound watershed by entering into agreements and making personnel appointments. Federal departments owning property in the watershed participate in planning efforts. The Long Island Sound watershed requires federal departments owning property to participate in planning, protection, and restoration activities. They must also ensure consistency with the Long Island Sound Comprehensive Conservation and Management Plan. Additionally, there is a Long Island Sound Stewardship Program with an advisory committee in place. The Long Island Sound Stewardship Act of 2006 is amended to extend the deadline to 2020 and exempt the Advisory Committee from the Federal Advisory Committee Act. Additionally, reporting requirements are updated to reflect the new deadline. The Long Island Sound Stewardship Act of 2006 is amended to change subsections and update authorization language. The amendments take effect on October 1, 2011. The Long Island Sound Stewardship Act of 2006 is amended to update authorization language, with amendments taking effect on October 1, 2011. SEC. 3. REAUTHORIZATION. The Environmental Protection Agency is authorized to receive appropriations for implementing specific sections of the Federal Water Pollution Control Act and the Long Island Sound Stewardship Act of 2006 for fiscal years 2016 through 2020. Additionally, $40,000,000 is authorized for Long Island Sound Grants for each fiscal year during the same period. The Environmental Protection Agency is authorized to receive $25,000,000 annually for the Long Island Sound Stewardship Act of 2006 for fiscal years 2016 through 2020.
